title: Love Island Australia producer reveals the REAL reason the villa location is in Fiji and not Majorca
text:
Love Island Australia season one was filmed in the idyllic island of Majorca in the Mediterranean Sea.

And now, producers have finally revealed the real reason the location of the villa was moved to the Pacific Island of Fiji.

Speaking to The Daily Telegraph on Sunday, head of entertainment for ITV Studios Majella Wiemers revealed it was to help facilitate the entry of intruders.

'We can be reactive': A Love Island Australia producer has revealed the REAL reason the villa location is in Fiji and not Majorca during the second season of the racy series

'We still have a crew of casting agents back in Sydney who are selecting contestants while the show's on air to come into later episodes,' she said.

She explained it was 'easier' to have the villa closer to Australia, allowing for a quicker flight to Fiji for the cast.

'We can be more reactive and send someone in within 48 hours if we think they'd be good for the villa.

Quick! 'We can be more reactive and send someone in within 48 hours if we think they'd be good for the villa,' head of entertainment for ITV Studios Majella Wiemers (pictured) said

She went on to say that the show has 256 crew members on the ground, which is just in Fiji, with them still having a number of teams in Sydney.

Love Island Australia is set to heat up screens yet again on Monday, with the introduction of an entirely new cast.

A number of the contestants have already started making waves, with a globe-trotting 'nudist' blogger to a handful of raunchy Instagram models confirmed.

Get ready! Instagram influencer and former Miss Universe Australia contestant Jessie Wynter (pictured) will appear on the show.

Perth-based personal trainer Gerard Majda has already been confirmed for the show, with him a proud 'nudist' for years.

Rhyce Power's ex Vanessa Sierra has also been confirmed for the show, with the contestant already a successful model in her own right.

Meanwhile, Instagram influencer and former Miss Universe Australia contestant Jessie Wynter will also appear on the show.

Don't forget to wipe the bench! Perth-based personal trainer Gerard Majda is expected to be a breakout star, with him living as a 'nudist' for years

Instagram sensation: Upcoming contestant Vanessa Sierra is best known for her tumultuous relationship with Jessika Power's brother Rhyce

The series is also getting lots of hype with Sophie Monk returning as the host.

Speaking to WHO magazine about what viewers can expect from the second series, Sophie said 'drama and diversity.'

'I think there's also a lot of drama because they are putting different types of people with different morals in there,' she told Who magazine this month.

The 39-year-old beauty said: 'From their occupation to their ethnicity and religion, they're so diverse. It is a really good thing.'
